newsitem.title: UK: Liverpool cotton markets see mixed interest.
newsitem.headline: Liverpool cotton markets see mixed interest.

text.p: Some sellers said they had found ready offtake from mills in Germany and Austria and also Portugal, mostly against Feb/March shipment requirements. But others suggest that demand is sporadic, noting that a strong dollar against major European currencies is something of an impediment to new business.
An expected advance in asking rates for better qualities does not so far seem to have materialised and spinners are thus inclined to maintain a hand-to-mouth buying policy.
Interest was on the quality of Central Asian shipments after an increased rate of arrivals at main ports for European markets.
